intro: Moniera scabrida, commonly known as the rough moniera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a rough, textured surface, giving it its common name. Moniera scabrida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
